data.title: Scene replication.
data.body:
document said "A node's user variables VariantMap will be automatically replicated on a per-variable basis. This can be useful in transmitting data shared by several components, for example the player's score or health.", 

If I don't want the player's score share for other player which contorlled by ohter human , for avoiding hacker watch the hidden infomation,  are there any feature can do this?
SendRemoteEvent() is good choice, but when need to sync many vars, it will use huge bandwidth and become troublesome.

data.title: Update rapidjson lib
data.body:
Lib now supports comments in JSON file: http://rapidjson.org/md__c_h_a_n_g_e_l_o_g.html

p.s. I'm not sure that correct change JSONFile::Save(Serializer& dest, const String& indendation) function - it requires some allocator instead poolallocator

data.title: Minor fix and helper function
data.body:
Added helper function to get an axis/angle from Quaternion.
Also fixed a bug when Urho crashes if AS ScriptObject throw an exception from ctor.

data.title: CollisionPolygon2D does not react to negative scales
typo JSONObjectIterator JSONValue::End()
data.body:
```
JSONObjectIterator JSONValue::End()
{
    ...

    return objectValue_->Begin(); // ??????
}
```
Also ThirdParty\rapidjson\include\rapidjson\prettywriter.h typo in comment
```
// Urho3D: in order to be consistent witht the XMLFile API, allow any character.
```

data.title: JSON parsing is limited/not supported with AngelScript
Unresponsive mouse selection on some UI sections
data.body:
I just noticed this when clicking the bottom part of Material Editor as you cannot do any mouse selection when it is set in its default window height. Tabbing works though until you reach the bottom section or do a resize covering from top to bottom of the editor 

![unresponsive](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3676827/25526260/58dbb232-2c45-11e7-9779-def9a47e84cc.png)

data.title: [Feature request] Models with large number of bones
data.body:
Current workflow with models with large number of bones is much less than ideal.
Basically it requires manual splitting, mending. Which is especially hard with models which have
morphs. It is obvious it can be handled automagically, without too much hassle.

Why it is better be handled in engine rather than exporter is the fact that only engine knows
limitation set on skinning.

I think it should be sufficient to load Model and split it to multiple structures which could be skinned separately. I'd like to handle this, but my engine knowledge is not high enough
to know what could be done in most effective way for such skinned meshes to work.

My first idea was to split actual Model resource to several Models which all can be added to own AnimatedModel component instance. But is it best way it can be done regarding performance and
memory usage?

Any ideas?

data.title: Texture artifact  appearing
IKSolver.spp: PVS-Studio: Non-void function should return a value
data.body:
We have found and fixed a bug using PVS-Studio tool. PVS-Studio is a static code analyzer for C, C++ and C#: https://www.viva64.com/en/pvs-studio/

We suggests having a look at the emails, sent from @pvs-studio.com.

Analyzer warning: [V591](https://www.viva64.com/en/w/V591/) Non-void function should return a value. IKSolver.cpp 57

data.title: PackageTool.cpp: PVS-Studio: fixed conditional expression of the loop.
data.body:
We have found and fixed a bug using PVS-Studio tool. PVS-Studio is a static code analyzer for C, C++ and C#: https://www.viva64.com/en/pvs-studio/

We suggests having a look at the emails, sent from @pvs-studio.com.

Analyzer warning: [V693](https://www.viva64.com/en/w/V693/) Consider inspecting conditional expression of the loop. It is possible that 'i < X.size()' should be used instead of 'X.size()'. PackageTool.cpp 148

data.title: Fullscreen rendering fails on Retina display on Sierra
data.body:
When a Retina (high DPI) full screen mode is initialized, possibly the framebuffer sizing goes wrong, and therefore the viewport Graphics tries to set is out of bounds and rendering fails except for clearing to the fog color.

Borderless fullscreen works. This is likely an SDL issue. Would possibly be worth investigating using a standalone test app and/or newest SDL2 master. I don't find discussion on the SDL forums, but this GLFW issue is similar:

https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/953

data.title: PBR Artifacts
data.body:
Not really using PBR at the moment, but checking the demos I noticed some pixel artifacts being rendered. Maybe someone can clarify if this can be tweaked or fixed by setup, but you can also clearly see it on some submitted high resolution screenshots like this one here:

http://i.imgur.com/4PdYkGA.png
[hilighted version](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3676827/25325271/4c264836-28fd-11e7-9457-cb64220efa6a.png)

data.title: How to setup travis-ci?
data.body:
I had forked this repo and pushed to travis-ci. Currently travis-ci would compile it with gcc clang mingw.
I want to compile with other plateform and auto upload the compiled binary to sourceforge like this: https://sourceforge.net/projects/urho3d/files/Urho3D/
How to do?

data.title: Pixelation with SavePNG or SaveJPG
Path Proposal
data.body:
_Edited to remove use of the term URI to reduce confusions where this proposal fails to conform to the standards for URIs._ Proposal for Urho's Path. I was looking for comments on it before I really start work. I think I'll try implementing it, but I don't know exactly how hard it will be, so I'm not certain how far I'll get... This is bassed off of the discussion in issue #1866 Also, I'm not really sure how the // should be handled after the scheme -- forbid it, allow it and treat it as just a single slash, remove it and only have the path start with a / if there were three slashes (like file:///home/... in Chrome)... # Path: ``` [Scheme:][Path][%SubFile][?Query][#Fragment] ``` All are case sensitive * ~~It is my opinion that we should actually switch the fragment and the query locations, so as to allow the fragment to be used to access resource pack internals and such. Basically I want to invert how true URIs are parsed. # will be used to 'look inside' a resource pak file (in part because # looks more like /) and represents new pages to load, while the query would be sent to the already loaded resource as a request for it to change its behavior (or clone itself and return the clone, e.g. Material.xml?MatEnvMapColor=FEED would return a clone of the material with the MatEnvMapColor set to the requested color). In accordance with this, I propose switching the position of the fragment and query as well.~~ (also removed the unnecessary and improper # from before the color) * **SubFile proposal:** Another proposal I have would be to allow another delimeter, perhaps one of the following, to be used to look inside a resource pak.: % ~ @ ; > + | $ /#/ [File/Path.file] <File/Path.file> * Path/To/Res.pak@File/Path.file, where @ is one of the delimeters (my prefered is %) * Path/To/Res.pak[File/Path.file] where [] are one of the matching delimeters * Perhaps allow a user-specified delimeter, and just choose a default one (my favored is one of the first three appearance wise, or /#/ parsing wise, though it does mean the fragment should not start with / ## Scheme ``` regex: ([^?#:]*): ``` Scheme may not contain ? or # (the former, at least, is not generally liked on filesystems) and in both cases this makes it such that a querry or a fragment will have priority in claiming the : so that a schemeless path with colon in query or fragment will be interpreted correctly Unlike proper URIs, slashes are allowed (e.g. Data/Save0:) Empty Scheme is allowed (":Path"). * Should ":Path" differ from "Path"?
-- Possibly, it could be used to convey certain information about whether to use the resource cache or not... ## Query ``` regex: \?([^#]*) ``` Query begins with ? and may not contain # which begins the fragment Empty Query is allowed ("Path?" or "Path?#Fragment"). * Should "Path" differ from "Path?"? -- Probably not ## Fragment ``` regex: #(.*) ``` Fragment begins with the first # and continues through the rest of the path. Use for resources that will not need to be reloaded, perhaps. I would say use for accessing resources in package files, as someone else suggested ## SubFile If my proposal is accepted for a different delimeter, then the subpath will extend from the delimeter to the start of the query, fragment, or end of the request, whichever comes first. If it is not accepted, SubFile would not be a part of the path Subfiles that begin after a / should be interpreted as just part of the path, with the subfile delimeter stripped (I think) ## Path ``` regex: ([^?#]*) ``` Path may not contain ? or # (the former, at least, is not generally liked on filesystems) and in both cases this makes it such that a querry or a fragment will have priority in claiming the trailing slashes, if needed If my proposal is accepted for SubFile, then the Path must also exclude that character Paths should follow unix-style conventions (i.e. forward slash) and to allow compatability with Window's drive letters, an option should be added to treat all single letter schemes as drive letters. # Relative Paths: A path will be deemed potentially relative if it contains /./ or /../ or ends with /. or Potentially relative paths should be evaluated to see if they are truly relative, stripping the previous directory with /../ and replacing all /./ with / and trailing /. with / (yes, this will prevent folders/files from being named ".", but it seems more convenient this way. If the path then begins with ../ from the replacements, it will be deemed definitively relative. A path will be deemed definitively relative if it begins with ./ or ../ or if it is solely . or .. If the path contains a subfile and an empty base the path is definitively relative ## Relative Path Evaluation Relative paths must be evalueated against an absolute base path. This base path should be supplied when the resource is requested, or the present working directory will be used. ### Scheme Resoultion If no scheme is provided by the relative path, the scheme will resolve to that of the base path and fall back to the resource chache/file system (no scheme or scheme file: or scheme cache: (TBD: which of these it will be)) If a scheme is provided by the relative path, that scheme will replace the scheme of the base path. According to an option in the ResourceCache/FileSystem, it will fallback to the default scheme (:, file:, cache: depending on what was chosen above) **TODO:** Decide on what happens if you request "Data:../Techniques/Diff.xml" * Should it evaluate to Data/Data.pak's folder/Techniques/Diff.xml * Or perhaps just "Data:Techniques/Diff.xml" (prevent relative paths from going outside of the scheme) ### Subfile Resolution Subfiles should evaluate the same way as a path if the resource pak had been used as a scheme I.E. "file:Path/To/Data.pak%Materials/StoneMat.xml" should be equivalent to "Data:Materials/StoneMat.xml" ### Path Resoulution The path should be appended to the base's path and then .. and . replacements should be made as needed. Traversal up past the root directory should not be allowed, but I think it should try to succeed by treating, e.g. /../../usr/ as just /usr/ (using Unix-style paths). If the base path contains a path and a subfile and the relative path contains only a path, it should be interpreted as being a subfile instead of a path, appended to the base's SubFile portion and then absolutized. If the base path contains a path and a subfile and the relative path contains only a subfile, it should be appended to see if it can be evalueated as a secondary subfile and if not it should replace the base path's subfile. * I think this should be impossible -- I feel the subfile should be viewed as just a path if there is no path If the base path contains only a path and the relative path contains [optionally a path and] a subfile, the realtive path [Path+]SubFileshould be appended to the base path path and evaluated accordingly If the base path contains only a subfile, it should be viewed as a base Path with no subfile instead. **TODO:** What about second-level subfiles (i.e. ResourcePaks inside ResourcePaks)? ### Fragment Resolution If my proposal for using a different delimeter (i.e. SubFile proposal) for resource pak extraction is accepted, the fragment should behave like an HTML fragment -- the resource will be loaded, then the FragmentRequest will be made, which will be allowed to return an Object (or void* or Variant) so as to allow requesting e.g. a Patch from a Terrain or maybe an XMLElement from an XMLFile, but the return need not be used (it could be used to, e.g. focus the UI on a spot like in actual web pages) In this case two more sets of methods should be added to the ResourceCache: * template<T> Pair<T,FragmentReturn> GetResourceAndFragment(Path) // loads the resource, calls the FragmentRequest(String Fragment) and returns it with the resource * template<T> Pair<SharedPtr<T>,FragmentReturn> GetTempResourceAndFragment(Path) // loads the resource as temporary, calls the FragmentRequest(String Fragment) and returns it with the resource * FragmentReturn GetFragment(Path) // will load resource * FragmentReturn GetTempFragment(Path) // will load temporary resource and return it's fragment. *Generally unsafe*, as the resource will be deleted before the return of the method, but if the FragmentReturn is a value type it could potentially be okay If my proposal for switching the behavior of fragments and queries is accepted instead: Fragments should not be stripped from the base path if the relative path does not contain a fragment Otherwise: Fragments should be stripped from the base resource (following html-style provisions) ### Query Resolution If my proposal for using a different delimeter (i.e. SubFile proposal) for resource pak extraction is accepted, the query should behave like an HTML query, sort of -- the resource will be loaded, and then a QueryRequest will be made that should return a 'copy' of the resource with a different name, parameters changed as needed. The return is required, unlike with the FragmentRequest, and the return of the ResourceCache's GetResource will be that of the QueryRequest. **TODO:** Decide what must be done for storing SharedPtrs to the resource, given that multiple queries could be but are not necessarily equivalent -- e.g. "Material.xml?UOffset=1 0 0 0&VOffset=0 1 0 0" should be identical to "Material.xml?VOffset=0 1 0 0&UOffset=1 0 0 0", if you ask me. //If my proposal for switching the behavior of fragments and queries is accepted: //Queries should be stripped from the base path like html //Otherwise: //Queries should not be stripped from the base resource (following html-style provisions) # Proposed Default Schemes ### file Used for FileSystem requests. Relative path . by default would be evaluated relative to the present working directory By default case insensitive ### cache Used for ResourceCache requests. Relative path . by default would refer to the root of the resource cache folders. It should search through all the resource cache folders like GetResource does now (so GetResource(Path("file.xml")) and GetResource(Path("./file.xml")) should be equivalent). By default case insensitive ### ResourceDirs (e.g. Data, CoreData) I feel that teh default ResourceDirs should be added by default. It is my opinion that, by default, adding a resource directory should add that as a Scheme based on the last folder in the directory path (e.g. /Path/To/Data would be added as Data) and the resource paks as the name without the extension (e.g. /Path/To/Data.1.pak as Data.1). A different scheme should be permitted, however, so as to allow /Mods/Mod0/Resources/ to be added as something specific, such as Mod0 or as Mod0/Resources. By default case sensitive ### http(s) Network requests, disabled by default (security) and disabled completely if Networking was not built with Urho. Possibly don't include and just let this be handled as networking is currently handled By default case insensitive

data.title: Trouble from viewport to image file
Travis CI - Emscripten incoming SDK (1.37.9) CI job ran out of memory
data.body:
Since upgrading to latest incoming the CI builds which use asm.js mode starting to fail during linking stage. From the log, it appears to be out of memory error.

Will try to investigate later if we could workaround it.

data.title: Android Studio: Could not check compiler toolchain as it does not handle '-E -dM' compiler
data.body:
I am getting this error through Android Studio, but it works fine through terminal. If I bypass the lines in CheckCompilerToolchain.cmake it seems to work fine. Can we have this check optional?
```
-- Check for working C compiler: /Users/sabo/Library/Android/sdk/ndk-bundle/toolchains/llvm/prebuilt/darwin-x86_64/bin/clang
-- Check for working C compiler: /Users/sabo/Library/Android/sdk/ndk-bundle/toolchains/llvm/prebuilt/darwin-x86_64/bin/clang -- works
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info - done
-- Detecting C compile features
-- Detecting C compile features - done
-- Check for working CXX compiler: /Users/sabo/Library/Android/sdk/ndk-bundle/toolchains/llvm/prebuilt/darwin-x86_64/bin/clang++
-- Check for working CXX compiler: /Users/sabo/Library/Android/sdk/ndk-bundle/toolchains/llvm/prebuilt/darwin-x86_64/bin/clang++ -- works
-- Detecting CXX compiler ABI info
-- Detecting CXX compiler ABI info - done
-- Detecting CXX compile features
-- Detecting CXX compile features - done
CMake Error at CMake/Modules/CheckCompilerToolchain.cmake:161 (message):
  Could not check compiler toolchain as it does not handle '-E -dM' compiler
  flags correctly
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMake/Modules/UrhoCommon.cmake:98 (include)
  CMakeLists.txt:18 (include)
-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
```

data.title: Compilation fails with URHO3D_IK=OFF and URHO3D_SAMPLES=ON
data.body: 45_InverseKinematics gets built, even if URHO3D_IK=OFF.

data.title: fixes #1907 - Compiler error when URHO3D_IK=OFF
data.body: Is the sample 45_InverseKinematics supposed to fail compilation if you set URHO3D_IK=OFF? I don't see any header guards around the physics samples (though I haven't tried compiling the physics samples with URHO3D_PHYSICS=OFF).

data.title: Compile fail with -DURHO3D_IK=0
data.body:
When i try to compile the engine without the IK module. Visual studio fail to compile Context::RequireIK() and void Context::ReleaseIK() functions. 

It seems that those function are not encapsulated inside any define like #ifndef URHO_IK

data.title: Fixed: Erasing sibling nodes from component destructor can result in segfault.
Added missing includes.
data.body:
The header ValueInformationInfo.h did not include the Variant.h and so its usage was sensitive to
the include oder.

data.title: Bullet RaycastVehicle support
data.body:
Hi!

This is initial release of RaycastVehicle component, which is wrapping of Bullet btRaycastVehicle.

Many features are missing, which will be added later.
The commit contains C++ code and AngelScript + Lua binding. But there is no Lua demo yet.
The component is not able to save/load yet (don't know how to do it).

The purpose of this PR is to recieve feedback and review. Please remember that:

It is my first submission and many things can be wrong. Please have patience and explain to me
what is wrong, I'll be more than happy to fix all things. Especially coding style errors might happen.
I'm from C/Linux kernel/MCU scenery and have very little (VERY little) C++ experience.
So please comment on general design errors, if I'm doing something wrong in general.
I have very little experience with gamedev, so I might do things not efficiently because of lack
of experience. Please point me on these, I want to learn.
The motivation behind this PR is current vehicle example is not that effective, and also very rigid.
I can't spawn 100 cars and have no frame drop.
However with this component I can run 100 cars without slowdowns. Also the flexibility is very good.
And it is easier than making everything from scratch.

The code is based on forum example by @Lumak edited and simplified by me to be minimal.
I plan to implement all features provided by btRaycastVehicle and provide Lua demo too. Also I plan to do general cleanup.

This video demonstrates abilities: https://youtu.be/LKjzcN3s65Y
With particles:
https://youtu.be/zC0iSozwiLM

Sorry for spamming, but github did not allow me to reopen for some reason.
A friend helped me to resove the issue with unreferenced symbols. This happens
when btRaycastVehicle.h is included, so I had to reimplement RaycastVehicle class using
opaque data, so no bullet headers are included with RaycastVehicle.h.

Remaining items (working on till weekend (till April 24)):

- [x] Remove CMAKE option, build with URHO3D_PHYSICS
- [x] Update AngelScript API to accomodate C++ changes
- [x] Update Lua API to accomodate C++ changes
- [x] Add Lua demo
- [x] Improve encapsulation (should not require wheel node hand-manipulation
- [x] Resolve motor wheels not rotating if no ground contact (Bullet behavior,
but it is very annoying)
- [x] Fix save/load crash
- [x] Implement wheel dust in demo (use @Lumak offroad vehicle code for this)
- [x] Move component code to physics subdirectory
- [x] Check coding style consistency (is there some automatic tool?)

Well, current wheel handling code is adequate. The problem might arise when simulating vehicles
with differentials, but I need to read more about this, but it could be implemented later.
Wheel blocking by brakes can be easily implemented outside the component, as it is only a few lines and not needed to be put in FixedUpdate. So I put this on post merge "some time later" schedule.

Sometimes later TODO:
1. Block/slow down wheels on intense brakes (component code)
2. Implement skids. (demo code)
3. Implement side momentum (demo code)

data.title: Bullet RaycastVehicle support
data.body:
Hi!

This is initial release of RaycastVehicle component, which is wrapping of Bullet btRaycastVehicle.

Many features are missing, which will be added later.
The commit contains C++ code and AngelScript + Lua binding. But there is no Lua demo yet.
The component is not able to save/load yet (don't know how to do it).

The purpose of this PR is to recieve feedback and review. Please remember that:
1. It is my first submission and many things can be wrong. Please have patience and explain to me
what is wrong, I'll be more than happy to fix all things. Especially coding style errors might happen.
2. I'm from C/Linux kernel/MCU scenery and have very little (VERY little) C++ experience.

The motivation behind this PR is current vehicle example is not that effective, and also very rigid.
I can't spawn 100 cars and have no frame drop.
However with this component I can run 100 cars without slowdowns. Also the flexibility is very good.

The code is based on forum example by @Lumak edited and simplified by me to be minimal.
I plan to implement all features provided by btRaycastVehicle and provide Lua demo too. Also I plan to do general cleanup.

This video demonstrates abilities: https://youtu.be/LKjzcN3s65Y

data.title: Populate a newly created rapidjson-value before adding it to the parent.
data.body:
When converting JSONValue to rapidsjon::Value, create the array elements and
object properties fully before adding them to rapidjson. This makes the
whole operation more efficient because it avoids a useless lookup on the
newly created/added elements.
